channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Falls Short of His Populist Rhetoric
item.description: The Trump administration is using its antitrust powers mostly to protect Mr. Trump.

item.title: Russia Bombards Kyiv Even as Ukraine Claims Progress in Peace Talks
item.description: The attack killed at least seven people, the authorities said, as an official suggested that President Volodymyr Zelensky was ready to go to Washingto...

item.title: City of 11,000 reels from ‘gut punch’ after Big Meat firm closes plant that employs nearly a third of the population
item.description: Amid record high beef prices, Tyson's recent moves are set to reduce beef processing capacity nationwide by 7%-9%.

item.title: Trump Administration Is Taking Billions in Stakes in Firms Like Intel
item.description: The Trump administration is trading billions of dollars of taxpayer money for ownership stakes in companies. The unusual practice shows no sign of slo...

item.title: Market Volatility Underscores Epic Buildup of Global Risk
item.description: Some experts see a dangerous combination of factors reminiscent of practices that led to previous financial crises.

item.title: Slack cofounder says employees are too bogged down by ‘fake’ work—he slams slides and pre-meetings for being ‘hyper-realistic work-like activities’
item.description: Slack and Flickr cofounder Stewart Butterfield says even CEOs and directors are guilty of doing ‘fake’ work—and it's on managers to ensure workforces ...

item.title: ‘It’s a little escape’: Airport workers find refuge in airport chapels during Thanksgiving rush

item.title: ‘I’m not going back’: Billionaire Marc Benioff says he’s switching to Google’s Gemini 3 after using ‘ChatGPT every day for three years’
item.description: Despite Salesforce’s new deal with OpenAI, Benioff is now more excited about Google’s latest offering. “It feels like the world just changed, again.”

item.title: Three brothers cleaned out their mom’s attic — and found a $9 million Superman that just became the most expensive comic ever sold
item.description: The comic "could've easily been thrown away," one brother marveled.

item.title: Kyiv Residents Doubt Peace Talks After Deadly Russian Barrage
item.description: A large-scale Russian aerial barrage on the Ukrainian capital killed at least six people on Tuesday. The attack came hours after a round of peace talk...

item.title: 100 Notable Books of 2025
item.description: Here is the standout fiction and nonfiction of the year, selected by the staff of The New York Times Book Review.

item.title: An Eritrean Woman Seeking Asylum in Canada Was Almost Deported From the U.S.
